covered: Valid Deletion: Scenarios TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC06, TC07, TC11, TC12, TC18, TC20, TC21 cover successful deletions and idempotent behavior.
Non-Existent Resource: TC12 demonstrates idempotent behavior when account does not exist.
Authorization: TC09 (missing header) and TC10 (invalid/auth) cover authorization-related errors.
Validation: TC08 tests invalid accountId format (regex/validation).
System/Server Errors: TC14 covers 500 Internal Server Error when DB unavailable.
Security: TC15 (SQL injection) and TC16 (XSS in header) cover input validation and security concerns.
Optional Parameters: TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05 cover combinations of optional flags, including default and explicit true/false scenarios.
Large Datasets/Performance: TC07 and TC18 cover performance/behavior with large numbers of subscriptions/invoices and concurrency scenarios.
Regression: TC19 and TC20 cover past bugs and backward compatibility, respectively.
gaps: Authorization: While TC09/TC10 cover missing header and auth errors, there is no explicit test for forbidden (403) when user lacks permission (beyond authentication).
Rate Limiting: No explicit tests for rate limiting or throttling under bursty DELETE requests.
Caching Behavior: No tests around caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) for DELETE responses.

Explicit Concurrency/Race Conditions: Real concurrent delete race conditions (two clients attempting to close the same account simultaneously) are not clearly described as a separate scenario; some coverage exists via TC17 but could be strengthened with a targeted race-condition test.

Pagination: Not applicable for DELETE unless listing/paginating resources; guideline mentions pagination-related checks but they are not relevant here; if applicable elsewhere, could be noted as not required for DELETE.
recommendations: Add a dedicated 403 forbidden test to ensure proper handling when a user is authenticated but lacks permissions to close the account.
Introduce rate-limiting/throttling tests to verify system behavior under burst DELETE requests (e.g., 429 responses or throttling behavior).
Add tests validating caching headers on DELETE responses where applicable (ETag, Cache-Control) and behavior when clients retry with caches.
Add an explicit concurrency/race-condition scenario where two clients attempt to close the same account at the same time to ensure idempotency and proper locking/transaction handling.
Consider a focused test for non-existent accounts with various edge-case accountId formats to ensure consistent 204/idempotent behavior across formats.
